questions.question: I would have been in bad trouble if she ………………….. me.
questions.description: In the third conditional we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: Would you mind getting ……………… my foot?
You can take anything you …………………..
questions.description: When both clauses refer to the future, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to future.

questions.question: I knew she ………………….. arrive before long.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, the verb in the subordinate clause too will be in the past tense.

questions.question: ……………………. she drove, she could not catch them.
questions.description: Fronted adjectives/adverbs are possible in a structure with as or though.

questions.question: Only after her death …………………….. able to understand her.
questions.description: Inversion is used when a sentence starts with only or hardly or seldom.

questions.question: Hardly …………………… arrived when trouble started.
questions.description: Inversion is used when a sentence starts with only or hardly or seldom.

questions.question: ‘I don’t like salmon.’ ‘……………….. do I.’
questions.description: After a negative statement, we can add another negative statement with neither/nor.

questions.question: As soon as they heard the gun shot, the birds …………………… away.
questions.description: Flew is the past tense of fly.

questions.question: Those who know the answer should …………………… their hand.
questions.description: Rise is intransitive raise is transitive.

questions.question: That is the last message he ……………………… from me.
questions.description: Present and future tenses are possible after this is the last...
